title: Hecarim 5.11 questions
body:
Patch 5.11
Passive - Warpath
UPDATE CYCLE 1 second ⇒ 0.25 seconds
E - Devastating Charge
MOVEMENT SPEED BONUS Stacks multiplicatively with other movement speed bonuses ⇒ Stacks additively with other movement speed bonuses

So with his passive can someone explain what that means?

And with his E does that mean it only adds the other buffs rather then multiply it?(So say before his E multiplied his speed by two and now his E only adds speed to him)

UPDATE:
I sorta understand hec's passive now but whats the change in his scaling now then from before the patch?

replies.body:
Passive - At present Hecarim's passive only recalculates how much bonus AD he gets once a second. That means he's potentially getting a bunch of bonus AD speed boosts after they've already ended (e.g. Homeguard after he's entered combat). Under this change the AD bonus is recalculated much more often, so the amount of extra AD he gets will much closer match his current speed, rather than lagging noticeably behind at times. 

For the E, yeah, it basically won't be much more effective when combined with other speed boosts than without. Using E on Hecarim without any other hastes should be unchanged, using it with major speed boosts (like Homeguard) won't offer as much total speed as previously however.

So with his E since it adds now rather then multiplies, wouldn't that mean you give his E a bigger boost in its early game then late game?(Ex. adds 30 at  first level now while before patch it was less since it multiplied his speed rather then add)

>So with his E since it adds now rather then multiplies, wouldn't that mean you give his E a bigger boost in its early game then late game?(Ex. adds 30 at first level now while before patch it was less since it multiplied his speed rather then add)

It's not really adding to his move speed in quite that way.

Before it took all his move speed and multiplied it by 75%. What this means is that if you have 200% MS from another source (2x MS) you effectively multiply that multiplier to 350% before adding the 75% on giving you 425% or 4.25x your base MS.

Now his E only adds to that multiplier meaning you only get up to 275%, or 2.75x your MS.

Doesnt that nerf him in a sense to drop his max potential by 200%?

Bear in mind I'm using 100% bonus MS. That's like 10 Zephers or Homeguard two seconds after you leave pool. Homeguards is the only time you should really see the interaction hit this hard, if you just have a tri there'd be around a 5% difference. It also has no effect on flat MS at all, so phage and boots are still just as good on him.

I hope this won't totally gut movement speed builds.
